intro: Loxostemon, commonly known as the candle bush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and consists of several species, many of which are shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their aromatic leaves and showy, often fragrant flowers that are typically white or pink. They thrive in a variety of soil types but prefer well-drained conditions. Loxostemon species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
